description: Geospatial location of the work order or service site; likely a point/shape from a GIS system. Confirm geometry type and coordinate system with SME.
Unique identifier of the work order record.
Current lifecycle status of the work order (e.g., open, in progress, closed).
Code indicating corrective versus preventive maintenance classification.
Short narrative describing the problem, service category, and system involved.
Work order category by maintenance type used for reporting and routing.
Date the work order was issued or created.
Date the work order was closed or completed.
Target due date for completing the work.
Identifier of the technician primarily assigned to perform the work.
Supervisor responsible for oversight of this work order.
Crew lead responsible for onsite coordination.
Code describing how the work originated (e.g., inspection, driver report, telematics).
Original request number from which this work order was generated, if applicable.
User who approved the work order or expenditure.
Classification of the requesting customer (internal, external, department, etc.).
Identifier of the person or department requesting service.
Name of the customer or requesting party.
Requester’s mobile phone number.
Alternate contact phone for the requester.
Requester’s email address.
Self-service portal account ID linked to the requester.
Identifier of the equipment operator associated with the request or asset; confirm with SME.
External issue or ticket reference that initiated the work; confirm with SME.
Short title or summary of the service request.
Additional comments supplied by the requester.
Supervisor notes or instructions regarding the job.
Priority level code used to schedule and triage the work.
Detailed description of the problem as reported.
Internal notes captured during intake of the request.
Internal key for the service site address record.
Street name of the service location.
Street number of the service location.
City for the service location.
Postal code for the service location.
Free-form description to help locate the work site.
Nearest cross street to the service location.
Custom text field 1 for agency-specific data; meaning varies by configuration.
Custom text field 2 for client-defined information; confirm intended use with SME.
Custom text field 3 reserved for local needs.
Custom text field 4; usage configurable per deployment.
Custom text field 5 for additional labeling or tags.
Custom text field 6 used for organization-specific details.
Custom text field 7; semantics depend on business rules.
Custom text field 8 for optional annotations.
Custom text field 9 for extended attributes.
Custom text field 10; confirm purpose with SME.
User-defined date field 1 for configurable milestones; confirm meaning.
User-defined date field 2 for local processes.
User-defined date field 3; semantics vary by client.
User-defined date field 4 for custom tracking.
User-defined date field 5; confirm with SME.
User-defined date field 6 used as configured.
User-defined date field 7 for optional events.
User-defined date field 8; purpose varies.
User-defined date field 9 for additional scheduling data.
User-defined numeric field 1 for configurable metrics.
User-defined numeric field 2; meaning varies.
User-defined numeric field 3 for client-specific quantities.
Summary of the actions performed to resolve the issue.
Related task or time entry number from a timekeeping or task module; confirm with SME.
Work request identifier that preceded and generated this work order.
Name of the work group or shop responsible for the job.
Project identifier charged for this work, if applicable.
Customer account identifier linked to billing.
Vendor identifier for outsourced or sublet work.
Sequence number of the asset within the work order.
Identifier of the vehicle or equipment being serviced.
Code representing the asset’s type or class.
Descriptive name or details of the asset.
Subsystem or component identifier within the asset, if specified.
Coded reason or symptom associated with the failure.
Narrative description of the failure condition.
Percentage of cost allocated to this customer, department, or funding source.
Post-service rating or evaluation score for the work performed.
Date and time the work was completed.
Optional field 1 for agency-specific coding; confirm intended use.
Optional field 2 for agency-specific coding; confirm intended use.
Equipment downtime attributed to this job, typically in hours.
Date the asset entered an out-of-service or repair state for this job.
Date the asset returned to service for this job.
Owning department, division, or customer of the asset.
Notes about the asset relevant to this work.
Flag indicating whether work is in progress or complete.
General ledger account charged for this line or work order.
Location or shop code where the work occurred or the asset is assigned.
Activity code identifying the task for costing or reporting.
Management unit or cost center responsible for the work.
Work-order-level accounting override for charges.
Work-order-level activity code used for costing.
Work-order-level management unit (cost center) for chargeback.
Work-order-level location code for accounting or reporting.
Asset line number or position within the work order; confirm with SME.
Sequence number of this line item within the work order.
Type of line item, such as labor, part, or contractor.
Identifier for the resource: employee ID, part number, or contractor code.
Classification of the line item (e.g., regular labor, part, contractor).
Description of the labor resource, part, or contractor service.
Quantity used on this line (hours for labor, count for parts, etc.).
Unit of measure corresponding to the quantity.
Cost per unit or hourly rate for this line.
Extended line cost calculated from quantity and unit cost.
Date the labor, part issue, or contractor charge was recorded.
Warehouse providing the inventory item for this line.
Storage location within the warehouse for the item.
Inventory category or type for the item.
Indicates whether the item code is valid or approved in the catalog.
Date or indicator that the item was received against this work; confirm with SME.
Free-form notes for this line item.
Item-level user-defined field 1 for custom data.
Item-level user-defined field 2; configurable meaning.
Item-level user-defined field 3 for local needs.
User-defined flag at the line level; purpose varies by client.
Sub-location within the facility where work occurred or parts were stored.
Accounting posting or charge packet reference for this transaction; confirm with SME.
Start date and time of the labor or activity on this line.
Finish date and time of the labor or activity on this line.
Timestamp when this record was created.
User or process that created the record.
Time of day the activity began, paired with the date.
Actual cost attributed to this line (sum of labor, parts, contractor, etc.).
Measured quantity of work completed for this line’s activity.
Actual labor hours charged to this line.
Actual labor cost charged.
Actual equipment usage cost charged.
Actual parts or materials cost charged.
Actual miscellaneous charges applied.
Actual contractor or sublet cost charged.
Total actual cost for this line; typically equals the sum of all cost components.
